          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["This is a very simple statement, and works as expected when "],
              ["$name", [["c"]]],
              [
                " is a string, but can cause problems otherwise. For example, if "
              ],
              ["$name", [["c"]]],
              [" is integer "],
              ["0", [["c"]]],
              [
                ", then type-juggling will happen during the comparison. However, itâ€™s the literal value in the case statement that gets juggled, not the condition in the switch statement. The string "
              ],
              ["\"input 1\"", [["c"]]],
              [" is converted to integer "],
              ["0", [["c"]]],
              [" which matches the input value of integer "],
              ["0", [["c"]]],
              [". The upshot of this is if you provide a value of integer "],
              ["0", [["c"]]],
              [", the first case always executes."]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",

          "version": 1
